intro: Lotononis polycephala, commonly known as the many-headed lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
